1.text: Start with a square sheet of paper.

2.text: Trace four diagonal lines from the corners of the square toward the center.

4.text: Bring every other corner to the center.

5.text: Stick a pushpin through the center.

6.text: Add a few small beads onto the end of the pin.

7.text: Make the pilot hole in the dowel.

8.text: Press the pinwheel into the dowel.

9.text: Cut a hexagon shape out of paper.

10.text: Connect all of the corners so that they meet in the center.

12.text: Fold every other corner to the center.

13.text: Push a pin through the center of the pinwheel.

14.text: Add a couple of beads onto the pin.

15.text: Make a pilot hole in the top of the dowel.

16.text: Push the pinwheel into the dowel.

17.text: Cut a sheet of patterned scrapbooking paper into four strips.

19.text: Consider adding a design to one of the long edges.

20.text: Attach the pieces together to make a longer strip.

21.text: Attach the first and last strips together to make a disk.

23.text: How glue an embellishment to the front of the disk.

24.text: Cut a circle cut from cardstock to the back of the pinwheel.

25.text: Use double-sided tape to secure the pinwheel.
